reviews.text: I paid less than £60 a night to stay here which I thought was terrific value for money. The best thing about this hotel is its location, it is very close to a whole array of shops, restaurants and nightlife. The room wasn't enormous but then it was only a single and with so much to do on your doorstep you aren't likely to be sitting in your room very much. Of the four hotels I stayed in on this trip to Japan I'd say this was my least favourite but it is by no means a bad hotel - it's just I'd say the room decor and hotel staff were just slightly below the very high standards set elsewhere. I'd definitely stay here again despite that though. Perhaps the only thing I would say is that It was a bit of a trek up to Shin-Osaka station so if you're planning on making lots of day trips by train you might be better staying elsewhere.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Have stayed at this location 7 times . Nice downtown location close to subway and shopping . Hotel staff is friendy and very helpful . Rooms are very clean and well appointed .

reviews.text: Location is the main reason to stay at this hotel. Shopping, restaurants and night life in general, are all within walking distance from this hotel. One of the main subway stations is right below the hotel. I have no complaints about the hotel itself either. Room was well equipped with flat screen TV, it was clean and spacious enough for two persons.

reviews.title: Value for money, but...
Great Hotel with fantastic service
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Nikko in October 2004 and was very, very impressed. This place is fantastic. The hotel is centrally located near the best shopping, food and nightlife in Osaka. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. Just like most of Japan the rooms were a little bit small but immaculately neat. The cleaning staff would bow to you and smile whenever you walked by. When it comes to service and cleanliness the Japanese simply cannot be beat. They take it to a new level. What a great experience ! Highly recommended.

We stayed at the Hotel Nikko Osaka from Oct 1-4, 2004. I took my 13 month toddler along with us. This hotel is the BEST location hotel in Osaka. It's right above the subway station, and it's right in the center of the "food" street and a lot of shopping ! The room we stayed in was a newly renovated one, with LCD tv, and contemporary decor.... and the staff there were SO helpful when they see us especially with our baby. They will come running to the entrance and help us with our bags and parcels... and when it was raining, they lend us umbrellas, and when asked directions to attractions and places, always courteous and polite. In all my Japan trips (a lot )... this has been the best hotel we have stayed at. I even wrote a letter to them to compliment their service. They replied with a thank you letter!
reviews.title: Awesome hotel in the best location
